Office for Global Engagement Newsletter
Issue 2, May 2019

 
 
 

Welcome to the April issue of the Office for Global Engagement newsletter.

News and updates on how we are implementing Ulster’s Global Engagement Strategy.

Welcome to this edition of the Global Engagement newsletter. It has been another energetic few months for the team, with our international student recruitment, support, partnership and mobility activity going from strength to strength.

With just weeks to go, the excitement around our GoPhilly initiative has really taken hold. More than 100 Ulster staff and students will embark upon this amazing experience during June, in what will be the largest mobility initiative of its kind on the island of Ireland and one of the most innovative in the UK. We have created further outward mobility opportunities in the USA and India and in this edition, we catch up with two students who will be volunteering in Fiji this summer. We couldn’t be more proud of the impressive (and creative!) Ulster students who have grasped these opportunities, and indeed the Global Citizenship agenda with such enthusiasm.

Our Global Recruitment team has also been active in our key regions, with 170 days of in-market engagement since our last edition. We were also thrilled to welcome 65 agents from 15 countries to Ulster during April, building on the success of last year’s Agent Conference and showcasing the very best of what Ulster has to offer to international students. I would also like to add particular thanks to our Provosts, Associate Deans for Global Engagement and our academic colleagues University-wide for their support and investment in the Conference. The enclosed review demonstrates just how important and impactful this event is.

In this issue, we will also give focus to the South and South East Asia region, with a particular emphasis on our work in both India and Pakistan. We will introduce Humair and Noel, two of our In-Country Managers who’s experience and perspectives have been crucial to the growth in student recruitment and partnering in this important region.

As always, we want to hear from you. Your feedback is always welcomed and please do get in touch to discuss how we can support your work.

Do visit our Resource Centre where you can learn more about the our teams and services, and access a range of dedicated data, guides, tools and advice.

Best wishes

Catriona McCarthy
Director for Global Engagement

 

Ulster's Growing Connections with Pakistan

Pakistan is the world’s sixth most populous country with a large youth population and strong ambitions for the transformation of its education system.  Learn how Ulster is developing relations in Pakistan to build on a range of opportunities in this diverse market.

Read more

 

Introducing Ulster's Country Manager for Pakistan

Humair Ahmad is based in Karachi and was appointed Ulster’s Country Manager for Pakistan in June 2018.  Humair also works to develop other regional opportunities in Bangladesh and is one of four country managers who have been appointed to work in strategically important regions on behalf of Ulster.

Read more

 

Ulster Hosts First In-Country Agent Conference

As Ulster's network of international agents in India expands read how this first, in-country conference has already made a positive and lasting impression of Ulster University.

Read more

 

Introducing Ulster's Country Manager for India

Noel Selvin has a long association with Ulster University, having represented Ulster for some 14 years as an educational recruitment partner.  He was appointed Ulster’s Country Manager for India in 2017.  He describes how this new focus has India on an upward growth trend for Ulster.

Read More

 

Life-changing Volunteering Expedition

Ulster students are bound for a life-changing experience, volunteering in Fiji this Summer.  Read more about what some students hope to gain from this once in a life-time opportunity.

Read more

 

Agent Familiarisation Trip 2019

In April we welcomed 65 agents from 15 countries in our second international agent familiarisation visit where both the best of Ulster University and Northern Ireland was showcased.  Check out the post-event report to gather a flavour of first impressions amongst this hugely important stakeholder group.

Read more

Regional Overview

South & South East Asia is fast becoming a priority region for international student recruitment. Gather more insights from the Regional Manager’s recent update.

 
Outward Student Mobility Profile

Geography student, Liam Evans, will be spending a month in Fiji this summer. The GEO team caught up with him as he prepares for this once in a life-time opportunity.

 
Outward Student Mobility Profile

Biomedical Science student, Megan Boner, will be spending four weeks of her summer in Fiji. The GEO team caught up with her as she prepares for this amazing opportunity.

 

Global News

Catch up on the latest Global Engagement news

 
Go Philly 2019 – Outward Student Mobility Programme

The Global Mobility and Experience team have launched Go Philly 2019, the University’s largest ever outward mobility programme which will give 100 students the opportunity to go to Philadelphia in June.

 
Mitchell scholarship winner to study at Ulster University

Alison Mahoney, the Co-Founder and Artistic Director of NYC-based Bluelaces Theater Company, has been selected as one of 12 prestigious Mitchell Scholars and will begin her studies in Contemporary Performance Practices at Ulster University from Sept. 2019.
